title: Arsenal consider offering "devastated" Granit Xhaka counselling after Emirates outburst
text:

Repentant or not, Unai Emery fears Granit Xhaka may never be forgiven by Arsenal fans for dissing the captain's badge.

Xhaka has cut such a disconsolate figure since his monumental strop after being substituted against Crystal Palace on Sunday that the Gunners hierarchy have so far refrained from throwing the book at him.

And the Swiss midfielder is so “devastated” by supporters turning on him that Arsenal are even prepared to offer him counselling.

For Xhaka, installed as skipper after manager Emery's dressing room poll of the players, there appears no way back after his sarcastic conducting of the crowd's jeers, mouthing “f*** off” at a section of his critics and tearing off his shirt in a huff.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

After he was given the bird against Aston Villa earlier this season, he may have burned his bridges beyond repair at the Emirates.

And Emery, opting for kid gloves where most managers would have chosen iron fists, admitted: “My ideal future is to watch Xhaka playing again with every supporter supporting him.

“I don't know if I can, or if I will achieve it, but this is my idea. It is not easy for him and the team. He is devastated now and sad. We can maybe remember some similar situations in the past for players, and they came back.

“For example, I was speaking with Hector Bellerin and he told how he received some criticism three years ago at the Emirates because people weren't happy with his performance, but he came back.

(Image: Reuters)

“The important thing is to transmit to people if they don't like you in one moment, to work to change that situation. I don't know how it will be in the future, I can only work in the present.”

Emery has spoken to Xhaka three times since Sunday's debacle, but he is still not prepared to say categorically whether his player would be stripped of the skipper's armband.

The Gunners boss has consulted director Josh Kroenke, son of Gunners owner Stan Kroenke, but he is only playing into the hands of the shooting gallery if he ducks the issue for much longer.

Emery insisted: “I do not want to speak about that – the first thing is to recover him (Xhaka).

(Image: REUTERS)

“I spoke with him this morning but only about him, his personal moment. I don't need his apology because I know he is devastated. He is now very down and we need to support him.

“I know, and he knows, he was wrong, but the first thing is to raise him up again. Time will give us the information (if the supporters will forgive him after an apology) and he knows we are here for the supporters.

“He has the condition to be captain - I decided that, the players respect that. He was wrong on Sunday and did not respond as a captain (should).

“It is not easy for him and the team. We spoke Sunday night, yesterday and this morning. He trained normally with the group but he is devastated. He is sad about the situation.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“His behaviour was perfect in training, with the group and the club, but really he knows he was wrong.

“He feels sad inside, very deep. It's normal as a human being. Every player needs the supporters' support.

“But he feels the supporters don't like him. We need to transmit a connection with them. In the last matches we connect, sometimes yes, sometimes no.

“We need to be strong, to learn to play under pressure. The supporters are the most important (people) in our lives – if they are not there and behind us, there is no reason to play football.

“He is down, but the most important thing now is to look after him and his family, and to recover our best Granit Xhaka.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

“We are responsible – me and the club. We know our responsibility is to help everybody, and also when making some mistakes to recognise it.

“On Sunday, after the match, Josh Kroenke was also in the dressing room speaking with me. We were talking for 10 minutes about the situation, but all the time helping each other.”

Xhaka, Calum Chambers and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang are among the players Emery has left at home for Wednesday night's League Cup tie at Liverpool .

Mesut Ozil, who has not featured in the last six matchday squads, is in the frame to make his first appearance in a month.

Arsenal predicted XI: Martinez; Bellerin, Holding, Mustafi, Kolasinac; Torreira, Willock; Saka, Martinelli, Smith-Rowe; Lacazette.
description: Xhaka was jeered when he was replaced against Crystal Palace on Sunday, and responded by telling home fans to "f*** off"
